result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb Jay Riley

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Caleb Jay Riley not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Caleb Jay Riley.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Parties are still in negotiations and are requesting an adjournment. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Caleb Jay Riley not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court ordered the State to file and Order to Produce.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court via zoom, defendant Caleb Jay Riley not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appearance waived.  Case is adjourned to 7/22 at 9:30  for an additional status hearing.    Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  mn  Status hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Caleb Jay Riley not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied bail motion for todays purposes. Case remains calendared as previously set for Plea Hearing on 06/10/2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. MOTION FOR BAIL MODIFICATION

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Caleb Jay Riley not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests Bail Bond Hearing and Plea Hearing dates. No objections from the State. Court grants requests. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 045766,
Payable Number: 1005888,
Receipt Number: 22RP019106,
Amount: $20.00
Case re-assigned due to the co-defendats lower pending case 18CF4266.

Defendant Caleb Jay Riley in court with attorney Toran.  Defendant Caleb Jay Riley in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Sargent K.Butch. Court took judicial notice of 21CF2392 & 20CF1492 (Waukesha CO. Case).  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Caleb Jay Riley not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. Defense is out of office for personal reasons. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Caleb Jay Riley in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Caleb Jay Riley in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caleb Jay Riley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 7.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Please see prior open case for defendant Blunt 18CF4266 and co-def. Riley 21CF2392
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
